item.title: A simple tiered Cache in Go
item.description: What is Cache? A cache is used to store data or files for faster access. A cache can be a hardware or software component. Data stored in a cache might be the result of an earlier computation or a copy of data stored elsewhere. A cache hit occurs when the requested data can be found in a cache, while a cache miss occurs when data can not be found in cache.
